The 'UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al' (English translation: 'University of Montreal') "[http://www.direction.umontreal.ca/recteur/documents/rapport-
annuel/rap_an2007en.pdf 2007 Annual Report]. UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al Accessed 20
October 2008. ('UdeM') is a public research university in Montreal,
Quebec, Canada. The francophone institution comprises thirteen faculties, more
than sixty departments and
two [http://www.umontreal.ca/english/overview/overview.html General overview
of UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al] affiliated schools: the Ãcole Polytechnique
(School of Engineering) and HEC MontrÃ©al (School of Business). It offers more
than 650 undergraduate programmes and graduate programmes, including 71 doctoral
programmes.The Times Higher Education World University Rankings of 2012-2013
ranks the UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al at 84th place globally .

The university has Quebec's largest sponsored research income and the third
largest in Canada, allocating close to $524.1 million to research conducted in
more than 150 research centres as of 2011. [http://recteur.umontreal.ca/pdf/documents-
institutionnels/rapportannuel/RduRenglish.pdf 2011 Annual Report], "Research
Income by University", p. 27 It is also part of the U15 universities. More
than 55,000 students are enrolled in undergraduate and graduate programs, making
it the second largest university in Canada in terms of student enrolment. [http://www.umontreal.ca/udem-aujourdhui/en/faits-et-
chiffres/index.html UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al official statistics]
